alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 3:36AM PST until February 22 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM MONDAY TO 7 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Lighter snow accumulations down to 1500 feet. * WHERE...Del Norte Interior and Northern Humboldt Interior Counties, including the Collier Tunnel on Highway 199, as well as Lord Ellis and Berry Summits on Highway 299. * WHEN...From 7 AM Monday to 7 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to slick, snow covered roads. Chain restrictions will be possible over mountain passes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a longer duration snow event, with relatively light amounts spread over a 24-hour period, but still enough to cause locally difficult travel conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

area.areaDesc: Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior
